Notes.Text:
This update for lz4 fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2021-3520: Fixed memory corruption due to an integer overflow bug caused by memmove argument (bsc#1185438).
- CVE-2019-17543: Fixed heap-based buffer overflow in LZ4_write32 (bsc#1153936).

Vulnerabilities.Description: LZ4 before 1.9.2 has a heap-based buffer overflow in LZ4_write32 (related to LZ4_compress_destSize), affecting applications that call LZ4_compress_fast with a large input. (This issue can also lead to data corruption.) NOTE: the vendor states "only a few specific / uncommon usages of the API are at risk."

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12 SP5:liblz4-1-1.8.0-3.3.1

Vulnerabilities.Description: There's a flaw in lz4. An attacker who submits a crafted file to an application linked with lz4 may be able to trigger an integer overflow, leading to calling of memmove() on a negative size argument, causing an out-of-bounds write and/or a crash. The greatest impact of this flaw is to availability, with some potential impact to confidentiality and integrity as well.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12 SP5:liblz4-1-1.8.0-3.3.1
